en.sc1: Let's look at the instance variables for class MHCLinkedList.
en.sc2: First, notice that class MHCLinkedList implements the MHCList interface. This means that MHCLinkedList is required to give implementations for all of the methods listed as part of the MHCList interface.
en.sc3: The first private instance variable is head, which points to the first node of the list. The header is a Node like any other.
en.sc4: The second private instance variable is tail, which points to the trailer node. The trailer is a Node like any other, but its next field is set to null.
en.sc6: Since there is no simple way to compute the length of the list simply from these two pointers, the list length is stored explicitly in numElements, and updated by every operation that adds or removes a node.
en.sc7: Because head, tail, and numElements are all declared to be private, they may only be accessed by methods of Class MHCLinkedList.
